item.title: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?

Wow you asking this finally taught me how to remove MD5 or “passhash”.

item.source: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?

item.title: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

They are basically correct, you have to remove the code that encrypts and decrypts the passwords. However, you cannot “remove” the encryption on a already encrypted password, because MD5 is really a hashing algorithm.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?

item.title: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

yes, in client.java search for passhash and then remove the passhash word only! none of the other text.
then search it again and remove the passhash word once again.

note: the passwords already encrypted on the files will remain encrypted until the file is updated (logging out and in)

Read full topic
item.source: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?

item.title: How do i unencrypt the passwords on devolution v7?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

remove the md5 file and the pass hashes in ur client.java…
if i were u though, id leave them encrypted for protection…
